sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Jocabella, or a cabinet of conceits. Whereunto are added epigrams and other poems, by R. C. Chamberlain, Robert, b. 1607.
Pp. [196]+ , plate
printed by R. Hodgkinson, for Daniel Frere, and are to be sold at the signe of the red Bu[ ] in Little Brittain, London : 1640.
Signatures: [pi]4 B-I¹² +. Plate = frontispiece. STC (2nd ed.) reports title as: "Conceits, clinches, flashes, and whimzies. ... Jocabella, or a cabinet of conceits whereunto are added epigrams and other poems, by R. C.". Copy filmed at UMI microfilm Early English Books 1475-1640 reel 2004 lacks all after signature I10. Reproduction of original in the Edinburgh University Library.
=======
Jocabella, or a cabinet of conceits. Whereunto are added epigrams and other poems, by R. C. Chamberlain, Robert, b. 1607.
Pp. [196]+ , plate
printed by R. Hodgkinson, for Daniel Frere, and are to be sold at the signe of the red Bu[ ] in Little Brittain, London : 1640.
Signatures: [pi]4 B-I¹² +. Plate = frontispiece. STC (2nd ed.) reports title as: "Conceits, clinches, flashes, and whimzies. ... Jocabella, or a cabinet of conceits whereunto are added epigrams and other poems, by R. C.". Copy filmed at UMI microfilm Early English Books 1475-1640 reel 2004 lacks all after signature I10. Reproduction of original in the Edinburgh University Library.
Daniel Frere
R. Hodgkinson
the signe of the red Bu[ ] in Little Brittain
